questions.question: Where did Neil Armstrong and Buzz Aldrin first walk on the Moon during the Apollo 11 mission?
questions.context: This site on the Moon's surface was the first site of human landing on July 20, 1969, with footprints still visible today in the lunar dust.

questions.question: Which enigmatic archaeological site in southeastern Turkey is known for its massive, T-shaped pillars and predates Stonehenge by several thousand years?
questions.context: Considered the world's oldest temple, this site has transformed our understanding of hunter-gatherer societies and their capabilities.

questions.question: In what city can you find the One World Trade Center, which stands as the tallest building in the Americas?

answer.label: One World Trade Center, New York City

questions.context: Completed in 2013, this building serves as a symbol of resilience and remembrance following the events of September 11, 2001.

questions.question: Where did the significant Battle of Hastings take place in 1066, marking the start of Norman conquest of England?
questions.context: This battle resulted in the defeat of King Harold II by William the Conqueror and is depicted on the famous Bayeux Tapestry.

questions.question: What is the name of the UNESCO World Heritage Site known for its striking desert landscape in Jordan, which also served as a backdrop in an Indiana Jones movie?
questions.context: This ancient city carved into red sandstone cliffs was once a bustling trade center and features the iconic structure known as Al-Khazneh.
